channel.title: NullPointerException
channel.description: Why in almost every thing i add to my server (mostly from another class) in the run server when i player its give me this errors? [b]Allstar[/b]

like:

public sof(client c){
this.c = c;
}
I think you know what this means but if ill use this class on another class maybe like command.java (not client.java)
this will give me errors:
pubic sof s = new sof(this);
This is not this, this should be something else because the parmeter is client and that class is command. so what i do?[/quote]then access it through the client or make a constructor for commands.

item.title: NullPointerException
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Thats what i usually do but if i have a parmeter to my loading class
like:

public sof(client c){
this.c = c;
}
I think you know what this means but if ill use this class on another class maybe like command.java (not client.java)
this will give me errors:
pubic sof s = new sof(this);
This is not this, this should be something else because the parmeter is client and that class is command. so what i do?

Read full topic

item.title: NullPointerException
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

It means your code is pointing at nothing.

For example:

public class MainClass {

	SubClass subClass;

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		MainClass main = new MainClass();
		main.start();
	}
	
	public void start() {
		subClass.printMessage();
	}

}
public class SubClass {
	
	public void printMessage() {
		System.out.println("I r not a null :)");
	}

}

The problem here is:

subClass.printMessage();

subClass hasn’t been initialized, so it’s default value is “null” or nothing.

the solution to this would be to initialize the object subClass

subClass = new SubClass();
subClass.printMessage();

This is just a super basic example. You didn’t really give enough information for me to help you in-depth

Read full topic
